Alabama.title: Property Tax Exemption
Alabama.shortDescription: Property tax exemptions for disabled veterans
Alabama.fullDescription: Alabama provides property tax exemptions for disabled veterans. Veterans with a 100% permanent and total disability rating receive a complete exemption on their primary residence and up to 160 acres. Veterans with lower disability ratings may receive partial exemptions depending on the county.
Alabama.value: $500-$3,000+ annually depending on property value and disability rating
Alabama.howToApply: File with your county tax assessor or revenue commissioner. Submit DD214 and VA disability award letter. Application deadline is typically December 31st for following tax year.

Alabama.title: GI Dependents' Scholarship Program
Alabama.shortDescription: Free tuition for dependents of disabled veterans
Alabama.fullDescription: Alabama provides free tuition, mandatory fees, books, and supplies at Alabama public institutions for dependents of veterans who are permanently and totally disabled, POW, MIA, or killed in action. Covers undergraduate and certain graduate programs.
eligibility: Child or spouse of qualifying veteran
Veteran rated 100% P&T disabled, POW, MIA, or killed in action
Alabama.value: $8,000-$15,000+ annually including tuition, fees, and books
Alabama.howToApply: Apply through Alabama Department of Veterans Affairs. Submit veteran's DD214, VA rating letter, and relationship documentation. Contact school's financial aid office.

Alabama.title: Free Hunting & Fishing Licenses
Alabama.shortDescription: Lifetime hunting and fishing licenses for disabled veterans
Alabama.fullDescription: Alabama residents who are 100% permanently and totally disabled veterans receive free lifetime hunting and fishing licenses. Includes saltwater, freshwater, and hunting privileges.
Alabama.howToApply: Apply through Alabama Department of Conservation and Natural Resources. Provide VA disability award letter showing 100% P&T and Alabama residency proof.

Alabama.title: Disabled Veteran License Plates
Alabama.fullDescription: Alabama offers special Disabled Veteran license plates for veterans with service-connected disabilities. Plates provide parking privileges in designated disabled spaces.
Alabama.howToApply: Apply at Alabama DMV with VA disability award letter. Complete disabled veteran plate application. Reduced plate fees may apply.

Alabama.title: Free State Park Entry
Alabama.shortDescription: Free admission to Alabama state parks
Alabama.fullDescription: Veterans with a 100% service-connected disability rating receive free entry to all Alabama State Parks for themselves and their immediate family.
eligibility: Valid veteran ID or disability documentation
Alabama.value: $5 per vehicle per visit, annual value $100+
Alabama.howToApply: Present VA disability award letter showing 100% rating at park entrance. May need to register for permanent pass.

Alabama.title: State Employment Preference
Alabama.shortDescription: Veteran hiring preference for state jobs
Alabama.fullDescription: Alabama provides employment preference to veterans applying for state government positions. Veterans receive preference in hiring and retention during workforce reductions.
Alabama.howToApply: When applying for Alabama state jobs, indicate veteran status and submit DD214 with application.

Alabama.title: Homestead Exemption Enhancement
Alabama.shortDescription: Additional homestead exemption for 100% disabled veterans
Alabama.fullDescription: In addition to standard property tax exemption, Alabama provides enhanced homestead exemptions in many counties for 100% disabled veterans, further reducing or eliminating property tax burden.
eligibility: County participation in enhanced exemption program
Alabama.howToApply: Check with county tax assessor for enhanced exemption availability. File alongside standard exemption application.

Alaska.title: Property Tax Exemption
Alaska.shortDescription: Property tax exemption for elderly and disabled veterans
Alaska.fullDescription: Alaska provides property tax exemptions for veterans age 65+ or those with a 50% or higher service-connected disability. The exemption applies to the first $150,000 of assessed value for disabled veterans and $150,000 for senior veterans.
eligibility: Age 65+ OR 50% or higher service-connected disability
Alaska.value: $1,500-$3,000 annually depending on property value and local mill rates
Alaska.howToApply: Apply with local borough or city assessor by January 31st. Submit DD214, proof of age or VA disability award letter, and ownership documentation.

Alaska.title: Free Hunting & Fishing Licenses
Alaska.shortDescription: Free lifetime licenses for disabled veterans
Alaska.fullDescription: Alaska residents who are permanently disabled veterans (50% or higher rating) receive free lifetime hunting and fishing licenses. Includes sport fishing, hunting, and trapping licenses.
Alaska.howToApply: Apply through Alaska Department of Fish and Game. Provide VA disability award letter showing 50%+ rating and Alaska residency documentation.

Alaska.title: Free State Park Annual Pass
Alaska.shortDescription: Complimentary annual pass to Alaska state parks
Alaska.fullDescription: Disabled Alaska veterans receive free annual parking passes to Alaska State Parks. Pass covers day-use parking at all state parks.
Alaska.howToApply: Request pass from Alaska State Parks. Provide DD214 and VA disability award letter.

Alaska.title: Veteran License Plate Designation
Alaska.fullDescription: Alaska offers veteran designation on license plates and disabled veteran plates for those with service-connected disabilities. Disabled veteran plates may provide parking benefits.
eligibility: Service-connected disability for disabled veteran plates
Alaska.howToApply: Apply at Alaska DMV with DD214. For disabled veteran plates, also provide VA disability award letter.

Alaska.title: Permanent Fund Dividend Garnishment Protection
Alaska.shortDescription: Protection of PFD from certain garnishments
Alaska.fullDescription: Alaska's Permanent Fund Dividend (PFD) received by veterans cannot be garnished for certain debts, providing financial protection for veteran families.
Alaska.howToApply: Automatic protection for PFD. No application required, but veteran status may need to be documented for certain legal proceedings.

Alaska.title: Burial Benefits
Alaska.shortDescription: Burial plot and services for veterans
Alaska.fullDescription: Alaska provides burial plots and certain burial services for eligible veterans at state veterans cemeteries. Includes opening and closing of grave, perpetual care, and headstone.
eligibility: Alaska resident at time of death (or spouse of eligible veteran)
Alaska.howToApply: Contact Alaska Office of Veterans Affairs or Alaska Veterans Cemetery. Pre-need applications available.

Arizona.title: Property Tax Exemption
Arizona.shortDescription: Property valuation reduction for disabled veterans
Arizona.fullDescription: Arizona provides property valuation reductions for disabled veterans on their primary residence. Veterans with a 10% or higher disability rating receive exemptions ranging from partial to full based on disability percentage and property value limits.
Arizona.value: $500-$5,000+ annually based on disability rating and property value
Arizona.howToApply: File with county assessor by September 1st. Submit DD214 and VA disability award letter. Application required only once unless circumstances change.

Arizona.title: Tuition Waiver Program
Arizona.shortDescription: Tuition waivers at Arizona public universities
Arizona.fullDescription: Arizona provides tuition waivers for honorably discharged veterans and dependents of deceased or disabled veterans at Arizona's public universities, community colleges, and vocational schools. Covers in-state tuition and mandatory fees.
eligibility: For dependents: parent killed in action or 100% P&T disabled
Arizona.howToApply: Contact school's veterans services office. Submit DD214, Arizona residency proof, and tuition waiver application.

Arizona.title: Disabled Veteran Hunt Permits
Arizona.shortDescription: Special hunting permits for disabled veterans
Arizona.fullDescription: Arizona Game and Fish Department offers special hunting and fishing opportunities for veterans with permanent disabilities. Includes disabled hunter permits and accessible hunting locations.
Arizona.value: Access to special hunts and locations
Arizona.howToApply: Apply through Arizona Game and Fish Department. Provide VA disability documentation showing permanent disability.

Arizona.title: Free Disabled Veteran License Plates
Arizona.shortDescription: Free license plates for disabled veterans
Arizona.fullDescription: Arizona offers free special license plates for disabled veterans, including disabled veteran and Purple Heart recipient plates. Some plates provide parking privileges in designated spaces.
Arizona.howToApply: Apply at Arizona MVD with VA disability award letter. Complete special plate application.

Arizona.title: Disability Income Tax Exemption
Arizona.shortDescription: Exemption of VA disability income from state tax
Arizona.fullDescription: Arizona does not tax VA disability compensation, providing significant tax savings for disabled veterans. Additionally, certain military retirement pay may be partially exempt.
Arizona.value: Varies based on disability rating; potentially $500-$3,000+ annually
Arizona.howToApply: Claim exemption on Arizona state tax return. No special application required beyond normal tax filing.

Arizona.title: Veteran Employment Preference
Arizona.fullDescription: Arizona provides veteran preference in state government hiring. Qualifying veterans receive preference points in the application process and priority consideration.
Arizona.value: Increased hiring preference and job opportunities
Arizona.howToApply: Indicate veteran status on state job applications. Submit DD214 and for disabled preference, VA disability award letter.

Arizona.title: State Parks Fee Waiver
Arizona.shortDescription: Free annual pass for 100% disabled veterans
Arizona.fullDescription: Arizona veterans with 100% service-connected disability rating receive complimentary annual passes to Arizona State Parks, covering day-use entry fees.
Arizona.howToApply: Apply through Arizona State Parks. Present VA disability award letter showing 100% rating.

Arkansas.title: Property Tax Relief for Disabled Veterans
Arkansas.shortDescription: Property tax exemption for disabled veterans
Arkansas.fullDescription: Arkansas provides property tax exemptions for disabled veterans on their homestead. Veterans with a 100% permanent and total disability rating or unemployability rating receive a complete exemption. Partial exemptions available for lower ratings.
eligibility: 100% permanent and total disability or TDIU
Arkansas.howToApply: Apply with county assessor. Submit DD214, VA disability award letter, and homestead application.

Arkansas.title: Veteran Dependents Scholarship
Arkansas.shortDescription: Tuition waiver for dependents of disabled veterans
Arkansas.fullDescription: Arkansas provides tuition waivers at state-supported institutions for dependents of Arkansas veterans who were killed in action, POW/MIA, or are 100% permanently disabled.
eligibility: Child or spouse of qualifying veteran
Veteran KIA, POW/MIA, or 100% P&T disabled
Arkansas.howToApply: Contact school financial aid office. Submit veteran's DD214, VA rating, and relationship proof.

Arkansas.title: Free Lifetime Sportsman's License
Arkansas.shortDescription: Free lifetime hunting and fishing license
Arkansas.fullDescription: Arkansas residents who are 100% permanently and totally disabled veterans receive free lifetime combination hunting and fishing licenses.
Arkansas.howToApply: Apply through Arkansas Game and Fish Commission. Provide VA rating showing 100% P&T and residency proof.

Arkansas.title: Disabled Veteran License Plates
Arkansas.fullDescription: Arkansas offers disabled veteran license plates that provide parking privileges in designated disabled parking spaces.
Arkansas.value: Reduced plate fees and parking privileges
Arkansas.howToApply: Apply at Arkansas DMV with VA disability award letter.

Arkansas.title: Military Retirement Pay Exemption
Arkansas.shortDescription: Partial exemption of military retirement income
Arkansas.fullDescription: Arkansas provides a partial exemption for military retirement pay from state income tax. The first $6,000 of military retirement income is exempt.
Arkansas.value: Up to $300-$400 annually in tax savings
Arkansas.howToApply: Claim exemption on Arkansas state tax return.

California.title: Property Tax Exemption
California.shortDescription: Exemption on primary residence for disabled veterans
California.fullDescription: California offers a property tax exemption for disabled veterans. Veterans with a 100% disability rating can receive a complete exemption on their primary residence. Veterans with lower ratings receive partial exemptions ranging from $100,000 to $150,000 in assessed value depending on income and disability percentage.
eligibility: Disability rating from VA (amount varies by percentage)
California.value: $1,000-$4,000 annually depending on property value and disability rating
California.howToApply: Contact your county assessor's office with DD214, VA disability award letter, and property deed. Application must be filed by February 15th for current tax year.

California.title: CalVet College Fee Waiver
California.shortDescription: Tuition waiver at California community colleges and state universities
California.fullDescription: California provides fee waivers for eligible veterans and dependents at all California Community Colleges, California State Universities, and University of California campuses. This program covers enrollment fees and can save thousands per year.
eligibility: Veteran with active duty service of at least 90 days
California resident for at least 1 year
Eligible dependents of certain disabled or deceased veterans
California.value: $1,500-$7,000+ annually depending on school and units
California.howToApply: Apply through the school's financial aid office. Submit DD214, California residency documentation, and fee waiver application. Some schools may require CalVet College Fee Waiver certification.

California.title: Free Hunting & Fishing License
California.shortDescription: Complimentary hunting and fishing licenses for disabled veterans
California.fullDescription: Disabled California veterans can receive free hunting and fishing licenses. This includes basic hunting and fishing privileges. Additional stamps and tags may be required for certain species.
eligibility: Valid California ID or Driver's License
California.howToApply: Apply online through the California Department of Fish and Wildlife website or in person at a license agent. Provide proof of disability rating (VA award letter) and California residency.

California.title: CalVet Home Loan Program
California.shortDescription: Low-interest home loans with no down payment
California.fullDescription: The CalVet Home Loan program offers competitive interest rates and unique benefits including no mortgage insurance requirement, forbearance assistance, and no prepayment penalties. Available for purchasing homes, farms, and mobile homes in California.
eligibility: Property must be in California and owner-occupied
California.value: Competitive rates typically 0.25%-0.5% below market, no PMI saves $100-$300/month
California.howToApply: Apply online at CalVet.ca.gov or contact a CalVet Home Loan representative. Submit DD214, income documentation, and complete loan application process.

California.title: Disabled Veteran License Plates
California.shortDescription: Special license plates with parking privileges
California.fullDescription: California offers special Disabled Veteran (DV) license plates that provide parking privileges similar to disabled placards. DV plate holders can park in disabled parking spaces and are exempt from parking meters and time limits at metered spaces.
California.value: Free metered parking and time-restricted spaces, reduced fee for plates
California.howToApply: Visit DMV with VA disability award letter, complete REG 195 form. Plates can be transferred between vehicles. One-time $22 fee (versus regular $50+ for specialty plates).

Colorado.title: Property Tax Exemption
Colorado.shortDescription: Property tax exemption for disabled veterans
Colorado.fullDescription: Colorado provides a property tax exemption of 50% of the first $200,000 of actual value for qualifying disabled veterans. Veterans who are 100% permanently disabled due to service-connected disabilities are eligible.
Colorado.howToApply: File with county assessor by July 1st. Submit DD214 and VA disability award letter showing 100% P&T rating.

Colorado.title: Dependent Tuition Assistance
Colorado.shortDescription: In-state tuition for dependents of veterans
Colorado.fullDescription: Colorado allows dependents of disabled or deceased veterans to qualify for in-state tuition at public colleges and universities, regardless of residency status.
eligibility: Dependent of veteran with 100% P&T disability or killed in action
Colorado.value: Savings of $10,000-$25,000 annually (difference between in-state and out-of-state)
Colorado.howToApply: Contact school admissions office. Submit veteran's DD214, VA rating letter, and relationship documentation.

Colorado.title: Free Lifetime Hunting & Fishing License
Colorado.fullDescription: Colorado residents with a 60% or higher service-connected disability receive free lifetime combination hunting and fishing licenses, including small game and fishing.
Colorado.howToApply: Apply through Colorado Parks and Wildlife. Provide VA disability award letter showing 60%+ rating and residency proof.

Colorado.title: Disabled Veteran License Plates
Colorado.fullDescription: Colorado offers disabled veteran license plates for veterans with service-connected disabilities. Plates provide parking privileges in designated disabled parking spaces and may provide meter exemptions in some municipalities.
Colorado.value: Reduced plate fees and parking privileges
Colorado.howToApply: Apply at Colorado DMV with VA disability award letter. Complete DV plate application.

Colorado.title: Free State Parks Pass
Colorado.shortDescription: Free annual parks pass for disabled veterans
Colorado.fullDescription: Colorado veterans with 50% or higher service-connected disability receive free annual Aspen Leaf Annual Pass, providing free entry to all Colorado State Parks.
Colorado.howToApply: Apply through Colorado Parks and Wildlife. Submit VA disability award letter showing 50%+ rating.

Colorado.title: Veteran Employment Preference
Colorado.fullDescription: Colorado provides veteran preference in state government employment. Qualifying veterans receive preference points in hiring processes.
Colorado.howToApply: Indicate veteran status on state job applications and submit DD214.

Connecticut.title: Property Tax Exemption
Connecticut.shortDescription: Property tax exemption for disabled veterans
Connecticut.fullDescription: Connecticut provides property tax exemptions for wartime veterans. Veterans with service-connected disabilities can receive exemptions ranging from $1,500 to $3,000 in assessed value based on disability percentage. 100% disabled veterans receive additional exemptions.
Connecticut.value: $100-$500+ annually depending on disability rating and town mill rate
Connecticut.howToApply: File with town assessor by October 1st. Submit DD214, discharge papers, and VA disability letter if applicable.

Connecticut.title: Tuition Waiver for Veterans
Connecticut.shortDescription: Tuition waiver at Connecticut state colleges
Connecticut.fullDescription: Connecticut provides tuition waivers for eligible veterans at state universities, community colleges, and regional technical high schools. Covers tuition for undergraduate and graduate programs.
eligibility: Connecticut resident for at least 1 year
Served at least 90 days active duty or discharged due to service-connected disability
Connecticut.howToApply: Contact school's veterans services or financial aid office. Submit DD214 and residency documentation.

Connecticut.title: Free Hunting & Fishing Licenses
Connecticut.fullDescription: Connecticut residents with 10% or higher service-connected disability receive free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses.
Connecticut.howToApply: Apply through Connecticut DEEP. Provide VA disability award letter showing 10%+ rating.

Connecticut.title: Military Retirement Pay Exemption
Connecticut.shortDescription: Full exemption of military retirement pay from state income tax
Connecticut.fullDescription: Connecticut fully exempts military retirement pay and VA disability compensation from state income tax, providing significant tax savings.
eligibility: Receiving military retirement pay or VA disability compensation
Connecticut.howToApply: Claim exemption on Connecticut state tax return. No special application required.

Connecticut.title: Disabled Veteran License Plates
Connecticut.fullDescription: Connecticut offers disabled veteran license plates for veterans with service-connected disabilities, which may provide parking privileges.
Connecticut.howToApply: Apply at Connecticut DMV with VA disability award letter.

Delaware.title: Property Tax Exemption
Delaware.fullDescription: Delaware provides property tax credits for veterans age 65+ or those with service-connected disabilities. The credit is up to $500 off property taxes for qualifying veterans.
Delaware.howToApply: File with county government. Submit DD214, age verification or VA disability letter, and property documentation.

Delaware.title: Scholarship for Veterans & Dependents
Delaware.fullDescription: Delaware provides scholarships for veterans and children of deceased or 100% disabled veterans attending Delaware colleges and universities.
eligibility: Veteran OR child of deceased/100% disabled veteran
Delaware.howToApply: Contact Delaware Higher Education Office. Submit DD214, VA rating if applicable, and school enrollment documentation.

Delaware.title: Free Hunting & Fishing Licenses
Delaware.fullDescription: Delaware residents who are 100% permanently and totally disabled veterans receive free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses.
Delaware.howToApply: Apply through Delaware Fish and Wildlife. Provide VA rating showing 100% P&T and residency proof.

Delaware.title: Disabled Veteran License Plates
Delaware.fullDescription: Delaware offers disabled veteran license plates that provide parking privileges in designated disabled parking spaces.
Delaware.howToApply: Apply at Delaware DMV with VA disability award letter.

Delaware.title: Veteran Employment Preference
Delaware.fullDescription: Delaware provides veteran preference in state government hiring, giving qualified veterans priority consideration.
Delaware.howToApply: Indicate veteran status on state job applications and submit DD214.

District of Columbia.title: Property Tax Exemption
District of Columbia.shortDescription: Property tax relief for disabled veterans
District of Columbia.fullDescription: DC provides property tax exemptions for disabled veterans. Veterans with 50% or higher service-connected disability receive exemptions on their homestead property.
District of Columbia.howToApply: File with DC Office of Tax and Revenue. Submit DD214 and VA disability award letter showing 50%+ rating.

District of Columbia.title: DC Tuition Assistance Grant
District of Columbia.fullDescription: DC provides tuition assistance for DC resident veterans attending public colleges, reducing the cost differential between DC and out-of-state tuition.
District of Columbia.howToApply: Apply through DC Office of the State Superintendent of Education. Submit DD214 and school enrollment documentation.

District of Columbia.title: Disabled Veteran License Plates
District of Columbia.shortDescription: Free DV plates with parking privileges
District of Columbia.fullDescription: DC offers free disabled veteran license plates that provide parking privileges including free metered parking and time-restricted spaces.
District of Columbia.howToApply: Apply at DC DMV with VA disability award letter. Complete DV plate application.

District of Columbia.title: Veteran Employment Preference
District of Columbia.shortDescription: Hiring preference for DC government jobs
District of Columbia.fullDescription: DC provides veteran preference in district government hiring, with additional preference for disabled veterans.
District of Columbia.howToApply: Indicate veteran status on DC job applications and submit DD214. For disabled preference, also submit VA disability letter.

Florida.title: Property Tax Exemption
Florida.shortDescription: Property tax exemptions for disabled veterans
Florida.fullDescription: Florida provides property tax exemptions for disabled veterans. Veterans with a 10% or higher disability rating receive a $5,000 exemption. Those who are totally and permanently disabled or age 65+ with a combat-related disability receive a complete exemption from all property taxes.
Florida.value: $500-$6,000+ annually depending on disability rating and property value
Florida.howToApply: File with your county property appraiser by March 1st. Submit DD214, VA disability award letter, and homestead exemption application.

Florida.title: Florida GI Bill Waiver
Florida.shortDescription: Tuition waiver at Florida public colleges
Florida.fullDescription: Florida offers a tuition and fee waiver for veterans attending state colleges, universities, and career centers. Can be used for up to 110% of the required credit hours for degree completion. Spouses and children of deceased or disabled veterans may also qualify.
eligibility: Florida resident for at least 12 months
Eligible dependents of certain disabled or deceased veterans
Florida.howToApply: Contact the school's veterans affairs or financial aid office. Submit DD214, Florida residency proof, and fee waiver application form.

Florida.title: Free Hunting & Fishing Licenses
Florida.fullDescription: Florida residents who are honorably discharged veterans with a service-connected disability can receive free hunting and freshwater fishing licenses. Includes most hunting and fishing privileges.
Florida.howToApply: Apply through MyFWC.com or at a tax collector's office or license agent. Provide DD214 and VA disability award letter.

Florida.title: Free Driver's License
Florida.shortDescription: Free driver's license for disabled veterans
Florida.fullDescription: Florida provides free driver's licenses to honorably discharged veterans with a service-connected disability. Also includes free identification cards.
Florida.howToApply: Visit a Florida DMV office with DD214 and VA disability award letter. Complete standard driver's license application.

Florida.title: Discounted State Park Annual Pass
Florida.shortDescription: Reduced fee annual pass for state parks
Florida.fullDescription: Disabled veterans receive significantly discounted annual passes to Florida State Parks. Includes entry for the passholder and up to 8 people in the same vehicle.
Florida.howToApply: Purchase at any Florida State Park by showing DD214 and VA disability award letter. Pass valid for one year from purchase date.

Georgia.title: Property Tax Exemption
Georgia.shortDescription: Property tax exemption for disabled veterans
Georgia.fullDescription: Georgia provides property tax exemptions for disabled veterans on their primary residence. Veterans with 100% service-connected disability rating or unemployability receive up to $60,000 in assessed value exemption. Additional exemptions may be available at county level.
Georgia.howToApply: File with county tax commissioner or tax assessor. Submit DD214 and VA disability award letter showing 100% or TDIU.

Georgia.title: HERO Scholarship
Georgia.shortDescription: Tuition waiver for dependents of disabled/deceased veterans
Georgia.fullDescription: Georgia provides the Helping Educate Reservists and their Offspring (HERO) Scholarship for children and spouses of disabled or deceased service members. Waives tuition at Georgia public colleges and universities.
eligibility: Child or spouse of veteran with 100% P&T disability, MIA, KIA, or POW
Georgia.howToApply: Apply through Georgia Student Finance Commission. Submit veteran's DD214, VA rating, and relationship documentation.

Georgia.title: Free Lifetime Hunting & Fishing License
Georgia.fullDescription: Georgia residents who are 100% permanently and totally disabled veterans receive free lifetime hunting and fishing licenses including all game and fish privileges.
Georgia.howToApply: Apply through Georgia DNR. Provide VA rating showing 100% P&T and residency proof.

Georgia.title: Disabled Veteran License Plates
Georgia.shortDescription: Free DV plates with parking privileges
Georgia.fullDescription: Georgia offers free disabled veteran license plates that provide parking privileges in designated disabled parking spaces statewide.
Georgia.howToApply: Apply at Georgia DDS with VA disability award letter. Complete DV plate application.

Georgia.title: Retirement Income Exclusion
Georgia.shortDescription: Exclusion of retirement income from state tax
Georgia.fullDescription: Georgia provides significant retirement income exclusions including military retirement pay and disability compensation for veterans age 62 and older or permanently disabled.
Georgia.howToApply: Claim exclusion on Georgia state tax return.

Hawaii.title: Property Tax Exemption
Hawaii.shortDescription: Property tax exemption for disabled veterans
Hawaii.fullDescription: Hawaii provides property tax exemptions for 100% service-connected disabled veterans. The exemption amount varies by county but can significantly reduce or eliminate property taxes.
Hawaii.howToApply: File with county real property tax office. Submit DD214 and VA disability award letter showing 100%.

Hawaii.title: Tuition Waiver for Dependents
Hawaii.shortDescription: Tuition waiver at University of Hawaii
Hawaii.fullDescription: Hawaii provides tuition waivers for dependents of 100% disabled or deceased veterans at University of Hawaii campuses.
eligibility: Child or spouse of 100% disabled or deceased veteran
Hawaii.howToApply: Contact UH financial aid office. Submit veteran's DD214, VA rating, and relationship documentation.

Hawaii.title: Free Hunting & Fishing Licenses
Hawaii.fullDescription: Hawaii residents with service-connected disabilities can receive free hunting and fishing licenses.
Hawaii.howToApply: Apply through Hawaii DLNR. Provide VA disability award letter.

Hawaii.title: Disabled Veteran License Plates
Hawaii.fullDescription: Hawaii offers disabled veteran license plates for veterans with service-connected disabilities, which may provide parking privileges.
Hawaii.howToApply: Apply at Hawaii DMV with VA disability award letter.

Hawaii.title: Military Pension Exemption
Hawaii.fullDescription: Hawaii fully exempts military retirement pay and VA disability compensation from state income tax.
eligibility: Receiving military retirement or VA disability pay
Hawaii.howToApply: Claim exemption on Hawaii state tax return.

Idaho.title: Property Tax Reduction
Idaho.shortDescription: Property tax reduction for disabled veterans
Idaho.fullDescription: Idaho provides property tax reductions for disabled veterans. Veterans with 100% service-connected disability or who receive VA compensation for specially adapted housing receive significant exemptions.
eligibility: 100% service-connected disability OR specially adapted housing compensation
Idaho.howToApply: File with county assessor by April 15th. Submit DD214 and VA disability award letter.

Idaho.title: Public Safety Officer Dependent Scholarship
Idaho.shortDescription: Tuition waiver for children of disabled/deceased veterans
Idaho.fullDescription: Idaho provides tuition waivers for children of deceased or 100% disabled veterans at Idaho public colleges and universities.
eligibility: Child of 100% disabled or deceased veteran
Idaho.howToApply: Contact school financial aid office. Submit veteran's DD214, VA rating, and birth certificate.

Idaho.title: Free Hunting & Fishing Licenses
Idaho.fullDescription: Idaho residents with a 40% or higher service-connected disability receive free hunting and fishing licenses.
Idaho.howToApply: Apply through Idaho Fish and Game. Provide VA disability award letter showing 40%+ rating.

Idaho.title: Disabled Veteran License Plates
Idaho.fullDescription: Idaho offers disabled veteran license plates that provide parking privileges in designated disabled parking spaces.
Idaho.howToApply: Apply at Idaho DMV with VA disability award letter.

Idaho.title: Circuit Breaker Property Tax Reduction
Idaho.shortDescription: Additional property tax relief for low-income veterans
Idaho.fullDescription: Idaho's circuit breaker program provides additional property tax reductions for qualifying low-income disabled veterans and seniors.
Idaho.howToApply: File with county assessor by April 15th. Submit income documentation and disability verification.

Illinois.title: Veterans with Disabilities Exemption
Illinois.shortDescription: Property tax exemption for disabled veterans
Illinois.fullDescription: Illinois provides significant property tax exemptions for disabled veterans. Veterans with service-connected disabilities receive exemptions ranging from $2,500 to complete exemption based on disability percentage and return from service date.
Illinois.howToApply: File with county assessor. Submit DD214 and VA disability award letter. Ongoing exemption requires annual filing.

Illinois.title: Illinois Veteran Grant (IVG)
Illinois.shortDescription: Tuition waiver at Illinois public universities
Illinois.fullDescription: Illinois provides tuition and fee waivers for eligible veterans attending public universities and community colleges in Illinois. Covers up to 4 years of undergraduate study.
eligibility: Veteran with 1+ year of active duty or discharged due to service-connected disability
Illinois.howToApply: Apply through Illinois Student Assistance Commission. Submit DD214 and residency documentation.

Illinois.title: Free Hunting & Fishing Licenses
Illinois.fullDescription: Illinois residents with a 50% or higher service-connected disability receive free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses.
Illinois.howToApply: Apply through Illinois DNR. Provide VA disability award letter showing 50%+ rating.

Illinois.title: Disabled Veteran License Plates
Illinois.shortDescription: Special DV plates with parking privileges
Illinois.fullDescription: Illinois offers disabled veteran license plates that provide parking privileges including free metered parking and extended time limits.
Illinois.value: Free metered parking and parking privileges
Illinois.howToApply: Apply at Illinois Secretary of State office with VA disability award letter.

Illinois.title: Military Retirement Income Subtraction
Illinois.shortDescription: Partial exemption of military retirement income
Illinois.fullDescription: Illinois allows veterans to subtract a portion of their military retirement income from state taxable income. The subtraction amount depends on age and total income.
Illinois.howToApply: Claim subtraction on Illinois state tax return.

Indiana.title: Property Tax Deduction
Indiana.shortDescription: Property tax deduction for disabled veterans
Indiana.fullDescription: Indiana provides property tax deductions for disabled veterans. Veterans with at least a 10% service-connected disability receive deductions on their primary residence, with higher deductions for higher disability ratings.
Indiana.howToApply: File with county auditor by December 31st. Submit DD214 and VA disability award letter.

Indiana.title: Purple Heart Tuition Waiver
Indiana.shortDescription: Tuition waiver for Purple Heart recipients and children
Indiana.fullDescription: Indiana provides tuition waivers for Purple Heart recipients and children of disabled or deceased veterans at Indiana public colleges and universities. Covers 100% tuition and mandatory fees.
eligibility: Purple Heart recipient OR child of disabled/deceased veteran
Indiana.howToApply: Contact school's veterans services office. Submit Purple Heart documentation or veteran's DD214 and VA rating.

Indiana.title: Free Lifetime Hunting & Fishing License
Indiana.fullDescription: Indiana residents who are 100% disabled veterans receive free comprehensive lifetime hunting and fishing licenses.
Indiana.howToApply: Apply through Indiana DNR. Provide VA disability award letter showing 100%.

Indiana.title: Disabled Veteran License Plates
Indiana.fullDescription: Indiana offers disabled veteran license plates that provide parking privileges in designated disabled parking spaces.
Indiana.howToApply: Apply at Indiana BMV with VA disability award letter.

Indiana.title: Military Retirement Income Deduction
Indiana.fullDescription: Indiana provides a deduction for military retirement income and disability compensation from state income tax.
eligibility: Receiving military retirement or disability pay
Indiana.howToApply: Claim deduction on Indiana state tax return.

Iowa.title: Military Service Tax Exemption
Iowa.shortDescription: Property tax exemption for disabled veterans
Iowa.fullDescription: Iowa provides property tax exemptions for honorably discharged veterans with service-connected disabilities. The exemption covers a portion of assessed value based on disability percentage.
Iowa.howToApply: File with county assessor by July 1st. Submit DD214 and VA disability award letter.

Iowa.title: National Guard Educational Assistance
Iowa.shortDescription: Tuition assistance for Iowa Guard veterans
Iowa.fullDescription: Iowa provides educational assistance for Iowa National Guard members and veterans attending Iowa colleges and universities.
eligibility: Iowa National Guard member or veteran
Iowa.howToApply: Contact Iowa National Guard Education Office and school financial aid office.

Iowa.title: Free Hunting & Fishing Licenses
